Street name # 123 Fracc. Something In Tijuana
This is the place where the cesar salad was invented back in 1958, its right in the center of avenida Revolucion one of the most important turist atractions in the city

Mision 19 is located in an impressive gold LEED certified building. It is beautifully decorated and has private parking. You can reach the restaurant by elevator, just make sure you input the actual floor you are trying to reach before you enter the elevator as there are no buttons inside.

Delicious traditional mexican dishes made with wonderful, fresh ingredients. We had the queso fundido (melted cheese with chorizo), chunky guacamole (with onions and tomato), chilli relleno (very fresh) and awesome chicken mole enchiladas (served with delish rice and beans.)
Calle Misión de San Javier 10643 segundo piso, Zona Urbana Río, 22010 Tijuana, B.C., Mexico
Revolución avenue between 4th and 5th street. Tijuana, México. CP 22000
lun to sat 10 am to 12 pm
Av Gobernador Balarezo 366, Davila, 22044 Tijuana, B.C., Mexico
calle 6ta #1210 Zona Centro 22000 Tijuana, Baja California Mexico Zona Centro
Great music is you like 80s freestyle / new wave kroq. Not too busy before 12 but music makes up for it !!
wen to sun 8 pm to 4 am
Av. Revolución 1127 Col. Zona Centro 22000 Tijuana, Baja California Mexico

This place has a cover charge of $13.00US. Within, there are several rooms, each with it\'s own music or event. There is a lot of seating in this place, perfect to sit around with a bucket of beers and chill with friends. The dance floors are OK, but it\'s more of a divey feel. There is a stage where live bands play. When we went there, we realized that there were more people here than the fire code may permit. But damn, the music was not bad at all, and the crowd was loving it.
Mon to Sun 9 am to 6 am (almost 24/7)

This place has a huge selection of draft and bottled brews to choose from. They also have a few food items on the menu. I had the portobello mushroom sandwich, which was good! My buddy had a pastrami sandwich, but it was over salted. I\'m giving them five stars because I liked the vibe, the drinks, and the good that I ordered.
Wed to Sun 8 pm to 2 am
The Tijuana Expo Tequila will take place October 12–16, 2016 on Avenida Revolución. The five-day event features live entertainment and tequila tastings from over 100 tequila brands.
The Baja Culinary Fest will take place October 27–30, 2016 in Tjuana. The festival includes workshops, conferences, kitchen demos and dinners.

When I lived in Tijuana, Mexico, one of the things that caught my eye (besides all the dead dogs and cholos) was a huge, almost palatial building in the middle of downtown. It looked like it was transplanted from Morocco and was definitely out of place in the brown and dusty ugliness that is Tijuana. On the front of the building in big red letters it read: “Jai Alai.”
Av Revolución, Zona Centro, Tijuana, B.C., Mexico

The Tijuana painted donkey, or Tijuana Zebra, came about some time in the middle of the twentieth century. The reason for painting the donkeys was to ensure that the animal be seen in photographs. Since the donkeys were mostly white, on sunny days with the old black and white cameras the donkey would be seen as a ghostly figure. A long-time tourist staple, the donkeys are usually set up in front of a cart on which tourists fitted with traditional sombreros sit and get ready for their picture to be taken. The donkeys live on a hillside below the Casa de la Cultura in Tijuana.

The OMNIMAX cinema has been part of the cultural center since the complex first opened in 1982. In October of that year, it premiered the film El pueblo del sol, which was made especially for the cinema\'s opening. The film presents images from the most representative regions of Mexico, and got very good reviews. It was the cinema\'s only film for 13 years. Today, the center offers a daily selection of films; it premieres about four films per year.
Paseo de los Heroes 9350, Zona Urbana Río, 22010 Tijuana, B.C., Mexico

Giant nude woman of Tijuana is also the artist\'s home. ... The huge woman, officially named \"Tijuana III Millennium\" by Garcia but known locally as \"La Mona\" or \"the doll,\" is a perky nude, based on one of Garcia\'s ex-girlfriends
José María Pino Suárez 1712, Libertad, 22000 Tijuana, B.C., Mexico
